theme noun [C]
(MAIN SUBJECT)
Add to word list

B2 the main subject of a talk, book, film, etc.: The theme of loss runs through most of his novels.
More examplesFewer examplesThe theme of freedom recurs throughout her writing.The father-daughter relationship is a recurring theme in her novels.On the surface it's a very funny novel but it does have a more serious underlying theme.The movies she makes are all variations on the same theme.Unfortunately, I had to leave just as the speaker was warming to his theme.

theme noun [C]
(TUNE)
a song or tune that is played several times in a film, etc. and represents a character, situation, etc.: a theme song/tune
music
  specialized a short, simple tune on which a piece of music is based theme and variation
a musical form in which a theme is played and then repeated several times with small changes: theme and variations for violin and piano
